content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Sure! Here's the implementation of the `extract_julia_code` function:

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    code_blocks = []
    in_code_block = false
    
    for line in eachline(md)
        if startswith(line, "```julia")
            in_code_block = true
            continue
        end
        
        if in_code_block
            if startswith(line, "```")
                in_code_block = false
            else
                push!(code_blocks, line)
            end
        end
    end
    
    return join(code_blocks, "\n")
end
```

You can use this function by passing your markdown document as a string to it. It will extract all the Julia code blocks, remove the code fences, and join the code blocks together with a newline. The result will be returned as a string.
